intro: Oxydectes sublucida, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
